data: NICU Gastroschisis - Initial Management (Module)
Admit/Transfer/Discharge
Notify pediatric surgery of admission
Patient Care
Refer to Gastroschisis: Initial Management and Abdominal Closure
Replogle Tube Insertion
Tube Size: 8 French, connect to low continuous suction
Tube Size: 10 French, connect to low continuous suction
Replogle Tube Care
Flush replogle tube with 2 mL Sodium Chloride 0.9% q3h to q4h to maintain tube patency
Monitor Intake and Output
q6h
Notify Treating Provider
If urine output is less than 1 mL/kg/h in the first 24 hours
Wound Care
Monitor bowel q1h for signs of ischemia, kinking and discoloration
Vascular/Arterial Access
If umbilical catheter required, discuss with surgeon before placement
Insert Peripheral IV (Intravenous) Catheter
Initiate peripheral IV catheter in upper extremity
Insert Arterial Catheter
Insert peripheral arterial line in upper extremity
Activity
Bed Position
Maintain lower torso of infant in a sterile transparent "bowel bag" until Pediatric General Surgery consultation
Bed Position
Position on side with rolls to support torso and bowel while in bowel bag
Diet/Nutrition
NPO
T;N
Continuous Infusions
Total Fluid Intake Ped/Neo
T;N, Neo Total (mL/kg/day): 100, Including IV Continuous Infusions/Fluids
amino acids (PRIMENE) 3.75%-dextrose 10% continuous infusion
See most recent TFI orders, IV, drug form: bag
dextrose 10%-sodium chloride 0.9% (D10NS) continuous infusion
See most recent TFI orders, IV, drug form: bag
Conditional Order - Ongoing
If/when nasogastric losses are greater than 10 mL in 6h,, then replace losses 1:1 q6h over 6 hours with sodium chloride 0.9% continuous IV infusion
sodium chloride 0.9% (NS) continuous infusion
Replace NG losses 1:1, IV, drug form: bag
Medications
acetaminophen
7.5 mg/kg, PO, q6h interval, drug form: oral liquid
10 mg/kg, PO, q4h interval, drug form: oral liq
15 mg/kg, PO, q6h interval, drug form: oral liq
acetaminophen
7.5 mg/kg, rectal, q6h interval, drug form: oral liquid
10 mg/kg, rectal, q4h interval, drug form: oral liq
15 mg/kg, rectal, q6h interval, drug form: oral liq
acetaminophen
7.5 mg/kg, PO, q6h interval, PRN pain, drug form: oral liquid
10 mg/kg, PO, q4h interval, PRN pain, drug form: oral liq
15 mg/kg, PO, q6h interval, PRN pain, drug form: oral liq
acetaminophen
7.5 mg/kg, rectal, q6h interval, PRN pain, drug form: oral liquid
10 mg/kg, rectal, q4h interval, PRN pain, drug form: oral liq
15 mg/kg, rectal, q6h interval, PRN pain, drug form: oral liq
Opioids
morphine
50 mcg/kg, IV, q10min, PRN pain, order duration: 4 doses or times, drug form: inj
Refer to Neonatal Drug Manual and/or pharmacist for dose interval
No concerns for early onset sepsis (EOS) OR Gastroschisis prognostic score (GPS) is less than 2
IV cloxacillin and gentamicin administered within 60 minutes prior to silo placement.Antibiotics continued while silo in situ
cloxacillin
25 mg/kg, IV, q12h interval, order duration: 7 day
25 mg/kg, IV, q8h interval, order duration: 7 day

Consider therapeutic drug monitoring with antibiotic therapy beyond 48 hours. Place therapeutic drug monitoring instruction orders as required. Consult pharmacy for subsequent gentamicin doses and levels for patients less than 30 weeks
gentamicin
5 mg/kg, IV, once, drug form: inj
4 mg/kg, IV, q36h, order duration: 2 day, drug form: inj
4 mg/kg, IV, q36h, order duration: 7 day, drug form: inj
4 mg/kg, IV, q24h, order duration: 2 day, drug form: inj
4 mg/kg, IV, q24h, order duration: 7 day, drug form: inj
Concerns for early onset sepsis (EOS) OR gastroschisis prognostic score (GPS) greater than or equal to 2

Initiate IV ampicillin and gentamicin immediately after admission (post blood culture). IV cloxacillin added to antibiotic therapy and administered within 60 minutes prior to silo placement. Ampicillin, gentamicin and cloxacillin therapies continue while silo in situ (Duration of ampicillin is based upon need to cover EOS)
ampicillin
50 mg/kg, IV, q12h interval, order duration: 2 day
50 mg/kg, IV, q12h interval, order duration: 7 day
50 mg/kg, IV, q8h interval, order duration: 2 day
50 mg/kg, IV, q8h interval, order duration: 7 day
100 mg/kg, IV, q12h interval, order duration: 2 day
100 mg/kg, IV, q12h interval, order duration: 7 day
100 mg/kg, IV, q8h interval, order duration: 2 day
100 mg/kg, IV, q8h interval, order duration: 7 day
cloxacillin
25 mg/kg, IV, q12h interval, order duration: 7 day
25 mg/kg, IV, q8h interval, order duration: 7 day
Consider therapeutic drug monitoring with antibiotic therapy beyond 48 hours. Place therapeutic drug monitoring instruction orders as required
gentamicin
5 mg/kg, IV, once, drug form: inj
4 mg/kg, IV, q36h, order duration: 2 day, drug form: inj
4 mg/kg, IV, q36h, order duration: 7 day, drug form: inj
4 mg/kg, IV, q24h, order duration: 2 day, drug form: inj
4 mg/kg, IV, q24h, order duration: 7 day, drug form: inj
Consult pharmacy for subsequent gentamicin doses and levels for patients less than 30 weeks
Pharmacy Consult
Reason for Consult: Dose Drug: Pharm to dose
Laboratory
gentamicin Trough Draw Instructions
Draw level within 30 minutes prior to 2nd dose administration (preferably, just before dose is given)
gentamicin Peak Draw Instructions
Draw level 30 minutes after the end of the 2nd infusion
CBC and Differential
Blood, Urgent, Unit collect, Collection: T;N, once
POC Blood Gas Arterial (incl Lactate and iCa)
q12h interval
POC Blood Gas Venous (incl Lactate and iCa)
q12h interval
POC Capillary Blood Gas
q12h interval
Capillary Blood Gas
Whole Blood, Timed, Collection: T;N, q12h interval
Electrolytes Panel (Na, K, Cl, CO2, Anion Gap)
Blood, Urgent, Unit collect, Collection: T;N, q12h interval 2 doses or times
Bilirubin Conjugated and Unconjugated
Blood, Urgent, Unit collect, Collection: T;N, once
Bilirubin Conj and Unconj Neonate
Blood, Urgent, Unit collect, Collection: T;N, once
Urea
Blood, Urgent, Unit collect, Collection: T;N, once
Creatinine Level
Blood, Urgent, Unit collect, Collection: T;N, once
Procedures
Communication Order
Planned silo placement procedure and supplies to NICU bedside
